Body:
I would like to implement a multi-tenant environment with IoT hub where I want to allow each tenant to connect directly to IoT hub (as service) to communicate with devices. Of course I would want each tenant to have access only to their own devices and not have the possibility to connect to devices from other tenants (thus I require the proper SAS).

Following the documentation on the ServiceConnect permissions, it would seem that it is not possible to do this restriction on a SAS level. I am expecting an URL like {host}/devices/{device_id}/...." (where .... is devicebound or messages or something)
column9:
but did not find a sample and the piece of code that I came up with result in Unauthorized.

I would like to know what strategies can I use to allow this multi-tenant connection to IoT hub. Did anyone manage to create a SAS with ServiceConnect to device specific URL? Is it even possible or what other workarounds are there for this scenario?

Also
column10: if you have any samples with generating a SAS that allows me to use the endpoint {host}/messages/devicebound
column11:
I would appreciate it a lot.

Thanks

Body: I do not *think* this was possible. Someone able to get data from devices can get it from any device. Devices can have the device-specific keys and all that but the same doesn't apply to services listening for data. One obvious option would be to create an IoT Hub per tenant :)
Which documentation of ServiceConnect permissions did you follow? And do you mind showing your code of result in Unauthorized"?"
It is indeed an option, but not cost effective and not so much automated. The maintenance is pretty complicated to support hub-per-tenant when you have hundredths of tenants.
